com.amazon.speech.speechlet

Interface Speechlet


  • public interface Speechlet

    A Speechlet is a speech-enabled web service that runs in the cloud. A Speechlet receives and responds to speech initiated requests.

    The methods in the Speechlet interface define:

    • life-cycle events for the skill as experienced by the user
    • a way to service speech requests from the user
    • call-backs from events happening on the device the user is interacting with

    Because a Speechlet is a cloud-based service, the life-cycle of the actual object implementing the Speechlet interface is unrelated to the life-cycle of the Alexa skill as experienced by the user interacting with the speech enabled device. A single Speechlet object typically handles requests from many users, from many devices, for many sessions, using many concurrent threads. Also, multiple requests that are part of a single session coming from a single user and a single device may actually be serviced by different Speechlet objects if your service is deployed on multiple machines and load-balanced. The Session object is what defines a single run of a skill as experienced by a user.

    See Also:
    Session, SpeechletException

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SpeechletResponse onIntent(IntentRequest request, Session session)
      Entry point for handling speech initiated requests.
      This is where the bulk of the Speechlet logic lives.
      SpeechletResponse onLaunch(LaunchRequest request, Session session)
      Entry point for Speechlets for handling a speech initiated request to start the skill without providing an Intent.
      This method is only invoked when Session.isNew() is true.
      void onSessionEnded(SessionEndedRequest request, Session session)
      Callback used to notify that the session ended as a result of the user interacting, or not interacting with the device.
      void onSessionStarted(SessionStartedRequest request, Session session)
      Used to notify that a new session started as a result of a user interacting with the device.

    • Method Detail

      • onSessionStarted

        void onSessionStarted(SessionStartedRequest request,
                    Session session)
                      throws SpeechletException
        Used to notify that a new session started as a result of a user interacting with the device. This method enables Speechlets to perform initialization logic and allows for session attributes to be stored for subsequent requests.
        Parameters:
        request - the session started request
        session - the session associated with the user starting a Speechlet
        Throws:
        SpeechletException - for any errors encountered in the processing of the request

      • onLaunch

        SpeechletResponse onLaunch(LaunchRequest request,
                         Session session)
                           throws SpeechletException
        Entry point for Speechlets for handling a speech initiated request to start the skill without providing an Intent.
        This method is only invoked when Session.isNew() is true.
        Parameters:
        request - the launch request
        session - the session associated with the request
        Returns:
        the response, spoken and visual, to the request
        Throws:
        SpeechletException - for any errors encountered in the processing of the request

      • onIntent

        SpeechletResponse onIntent(IntentRequest request,
                         Session session)
                           throws SpeechletException
        Entry point for handling speech initiated requests.
        This is where the bulk of the Speechlet logic lives. Intent requests are handled by this method and return responses to render to the user.
        If this is the initial request of a new Speechlet session, Session.isNew() returns true. Otherwise, this is a subsequent request within an existing session.
        Parameters:
        request - the intent request to handle
        session - the session associated with the request
        Returns:
        the response, spoken and visual, to the request
        Throws:
        SpeechletException - for any errors encountered in the processing of the request

      • onSessionEnded

        void onSessionEnded(SessionEndedRequest request,
                  Session session)
                    throws SpeechletException
        Callback used to notify that the session ended as a result of the user interacting, or not interacting with the device. This method is not invoked if the Speechlet itself ended the session using SpeechletResponse.setShouldEndSession(boolean).
        Parameters:
        request - the end of session request
        session - the session associated with the request
        Throws:
        SpeechletException - for any errors encountered in the processing of the request
